pageContext.description: A very powerful weapon. Asymmetrical. Hilt has probably been broken, edges hammered: 2 rivet notches show traces of large rivet heads 3/4" diam. There may have been 3 holes originally. Numerous small punch marks on hilt. Clearly defined straight line on both faces show weapon to have been hafted at right angles. Strong but narrow midrib, curved; square heel. Edges fairly sharp, undamaged - 3 ridges parallel to edges produced by 2 grooves; worn.
pageContext.surface: Excellently preserved; lustrous dark purplish brown.
pageContext.publications: Arch. Camb. 1928,Bul. Bd. Celtic Studies, 1928,S. P. O Riordain, Archaeologia, Vol. 86, 1936, p. 313, No. 3.
pageContext.collection: Major Samual John Vaughaun, Nannan (& Massybrymwr), Near Dogellry,[?Ask] to be made for National Museum of Wales, Cardiff,=28.450/1,PW. No. 401
pageContext.site: Wales,Gwynedd,Llanfachreth,"Found at Dolfrwunog (Afon Wen Valley, West Side) July 15, 1826.",(Record scratched on blade near hilt.), Discovered 1927 in an old tin box that had been at Hengwrt.
pageContext.remarks: Distinctly Irish type, probably imported. Found in gold-producing region.,O Riordain Type 4
